About Me
I am a doctoral candidate in Sociology at the University of Washington, specializing in innovative survey methodologies, demographic research. My work focuses on developing novel sampling and recruitment strategies to study hard-to-reach populations, with an emphasis on online and network-based methods. I expect to graduate in June 2025.


Research Interests
My research tackles pressing challenges in demography, such as surveying populations without a sampling frame and addressing the limitations of traditional data collection methods. I am particularly interested in:

Online recruitment and social media surveys

Network-based sampling (e.g., respondent-driven sampling)

Health and social outcomes among vulnerable populations
Applications of LLMs in survey research
